MAYBE this has something to do the stock movement........On December 8, 2017, Apollo Medical Holdings, Inc. (the "Company") completed a merger (the "Merger") with Network Medical Management, Inc., a California corporation ("NMM"). As a result of the Merger, NMM became a wholly owned subsidiary of the Company, and immediately following the consummation of the Merger, the former NMM shareholders owned more than 80% of the issued and outstanding shares of the Company’s common stock as previously disclosed in the Company’s filings with the Securities and Exchange Commission.As a condition to the closing of the Merger, all of the former NMM shareholders entered into Lock-Up Agreements with the Company, each dated December 6, 2017 (the "Lock-Up Agreements"). Under the terms of each Lock-Up Agreement, the former NMM shareholders agreed not to, without the prior written consent of the Company and except in limited circumstances, (i) offer, pledge, sell, contract to sell, sell any option or contract to purchase, purchase any option or contract to sell, grant any option, right or warrant to purchase or otherwise transfer or dispose of Company common stock they received from the Merger (the "Covered Securities"), or (ii) enter into any swap or other agreement that transfers, in whole or in part, any of the economic consequences of ownership of the Covered Securities. The lock-up restrictions terminate with respect to one-third of the Covered Securities immediately following each of (i) the 18th month anniversary of the effective time of the Merger (the "First Lock Up Period"), (ii) the 30th month anniversary of the effective time of the Merger (the "Second Lock Up Period"), and (iii) the 42nd month anniversary of the effective time of the Merger (the “Third Lock Up Period”). Pursuant to certain amendments to the Lock-Up Agreements, the former NMM shareholders agreed to extend the expiration date on the First Lock-Up Period from June 7, 2019 to September 30, 2019, and thereafter, to further extend the expiration date of the First Lock-Up Period from September 30, 2019 to January 31, 2020. The other terms of the Lock-Up Agreements remain unchanged.The Third Lock Up Period ended on June 9, 2021. As a result, the Company estimates that approximately 10,482,764 shares of the Company’s common stock became eligible for sale on the public market at the open of trading on June 9, 2021, subject to restrictions set forth in the Company’s insider trading policy and under applicable law.

FYI........RECOMMENDATIONWe rate APOLLO MEDICAL HOLDING INC (AMEH) a BUY. This is based on the convergence of positiveinvestment measures, which should help this stock outperform the majority of stocks that we rate. Thecompany's strengths can be seen in multiple areas, such as its revenue growth, largely solid financialposition with reasonable debt levels by most measures, impressive record of earnings per share growth,compelling growth in net income and good cash flow from operations. We feel its strengths outweigh thefact that the company shows low profit margins.HIGHLIGHTSAMEH's revenue growth has slightly outpaced the subsector average of 6.6%. Since the same quarter oneyear prior, revenues slightly increased by 6.6%. Growth in the company's revenue appears to have helpedboost the earnings per share.The debt-to-equity ratio is somewhat low, currently at 0.74, and is less than that of the subsector average,implying that there has been a relatively successful effort in the management of debt levels. Along with this,the company maintains a quick ratio of 2.85, which clearly demonstrates the ability to cover short-term cashneeds.APOLLO MEDICAL HOLDING INC reported significant earnings per share improvement in the most recentquarter compared to the same quarter a year ago. The company has demonstrated a pattern of positiveearnings per share growth over the past two years. We feel that this trend should continue. During the pastfiscal year, APOLLO MEDICAL HOLDING INC increased its bottom line by earning $1.01 versus $0.37 in theprior year. This year, the market expects an improvement in earnings ($1.28 versus $1.01).The net income growth from the same quarter one year ago has significantly exceeded that of the AmbulatoryHealth Care Services subsector average, but is less than that of the S&P 500. The net income increased by224.6% when compared to the same quarter one year prior, rising from $4.05 million to $13.15 million.Net operating cash flow has significantly increased by 207.09% to $9.95 million when compared to the samequarter last year. In addition, APOLLO MEDICAL HOLDING INC has also vastly surpassed the subsectoraverage cash flow growth rate of 61.12%

Basically AMEH is a new company that resulted from a reverse merger with Network Medical Management back in December....120 million in cash with only 5 million in debt...likely upwards to 400 mil revenues this year...I expect at least 80-90 mil plus gross earnings...38 million shares with almost 50% owned by insiders...and:"We believe that there will be no further material investments necessary to support the new contracts in Q2 and expect that post-merger integration costs will be less in Q2 than in Q1 and the integration will be substantially completed by the end of Q2."Traded as high as $29 immediately after the merger and fell into the doldrums likely due to lack of analyst coverage and lack of liquidity. I expect a rally back towards $30 between now and December.
